intro: Trillium erectum, commonly known as wake robin, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 12–24 inches. The plant features three broad, waxy leaves that are usually heart-shaped and a single, upright flower with three petals. The flower is typically white or pale pink and blooms in early spring. It thrives in moist, rich soils and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
